page.title: 20RETIREMENT
page.content: { RETIREMENT Many people come to Cornwall to retire. Here is an account of one such person. I chose this part of Cornwall because it is quiet and has unspoilt country side. I spent many happy holidays in the neighbouring village of Coverack but decided to settle here because it is on the level and offers easy access to village shops, church, doctors surgery and the farm for dairy produce unlike some of the fishing villages which have very steep hills. St. Keverne is a good starting point for cliff walks which lead down to many isolated coves and well kept National Trust land. There are disadvantages without a car namely distance to a railway station, airport, hospital, live theatre but this community helps each other and it is a haven of peace after the city.
